title: Lecture 2
content:
Strings What is the value of variable `u` from the code below?
once = "umbr"repeat = "ella"u = once + (repeat+" ")*4  umbrella ella ella ella  check  umbrellaellaellaella  close  umbrella  close  umbrella4  close Check Comparisons What does the code below print?
pset_time = 15sleep_time = 8print(sleep_time > pset_time)derive = Truedrink = Falseboth = drink and deriveprint(both)  False then False  check  False then True  close  True then False  close  True then True  close Check   Show Solution View video page Download video Download transcript Branching What’s printed when x = 0 and y = 5?
x = float(input("Enter a number for x: "))y = float(input("Enter a number for y: "))if x == y:if y != 0:print("x / y is", x/y)elif x < y:print("x is smaller")else:print("y is smaller")  x is smaller  check  y is smaller  close  x / y is 0.0  close Check   Show Solution View video page Download video Download transcript While Loops In the code below from Lecture 2, what is printed when you type “Right”?
n = input("You're in the Lost Forest. Go left or right? ")while n == "right":n = input("You're in the Lost Forest. Go left or right? ")print("You got out of the Lost Forest!")  You're in the Lost Forest. Go left or right?  close  You got out of the Lost Forest!  check Check   Show Solution View video page Download video Download transcript For Loops What is printed when the below code is run?
mysum = 0for i in range(5, 11, 2):mysum += iif mysum == 5:breakmysum += 1print(mysum)  5  check  6  close  21  close  24  close Check   Show Solution View video page Download video Download transcript
